alert.note: Alert for Macomb (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 7:25PM EST until January 28 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Michigan... North Branch Clinton Near Mt Clemens affecting Macomb County. .River levels will continue to fall through the remainder of the weekend. For the N.br. Clinton River...including Mt Clemens...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Branch Clinton near Mt Clemens. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Impact...At 15.0 feet, Agricultural land along the river begins to flood. When the river reaches this level due to rain, the Middle Branch Clinton River usually is flooding in some locations. The middle branch will crest about 24 hours earlier than the north branch. 21 and 22 Mile Roads may be flooded. Water could also reach the foundation of a few homes along the bank of the middle branch by Heyndrich and Cass Avenue. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=DTX. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 930 AM EST.
